page.title: 18 BOARS HILL - BAYWORTH
page.content: Bayworth is a small hamlet with a population of about 200. It lies on the south west slope of Boars Hill. Bayworth is part of the Parish of Sunningwell,Anglicans worship at St. Leonard's church and the children begin their education at Sunningwell Primary School, transferring, at the age of 11 to Secondary Schools in Abingdon. There is a small Baptist chapel. The houses are chiefly small semi-detatched Council houses with a small number of flats for old people. There is a small permanent caravan site providing homes for 20 families. Sunningwell provides a social centre for Bayworth and includes "The Flowing Well" inn where the game "Aunt Sally" is played. The village hall at Sunningwell provides a centre for social gatherings including Bingo evenings.
